nodes.bodyText: This is an interface, maybe you meant the same method on the AbstractMoveSelectorFactory?. Added, thanks.
I didn't notice it in the previous PR but this should be called create() for consistency with SolverFactory.

TODO improve this method in the next PR (I can do that).

Add a zero-arg method instead of checking whether the argument is null.
Maybe access entityDescriptorMap directly.

Please don't access collections directly. Leaking references to collections leads to a virtual impossibility of figuring out who has the opportunity to read (and more importantly write) it.
The config code is full of places where collections are being exported to other places, where they are being modified indiscriminately. Refactoring such code becomes a nightmare, as you are never sure if you've covered all the possible state mutators.
Therefore I would like to suggest that exporting a modifiable collection should be prohibited.

As for the first suggestion, I will look into it in the next PR, which will be focused on the entity and value selection config. As for the second suggestion, I would end up duplicating a part of the getGenuineEntityDescriptors method, with the drawbacks @triceo has mentioned (although the reference does not leak out the class).
@yurloc could you please explain what is your concern about not accessing the map directly?
The original post in this thread was a note for myself. I understand the second suggestion might be a bit confusing. Let's continue on line 733.
I fully agree with what Lukas have said.
This method, it's actually two methods. One accepts the argument, the other doesn't need it. Let's do it like that.
will be addressed in the next PR, see the comment below.
I'd prefer a no-arg overload to just putting null here.
will be addressed in the next PR, see the comment below.
Same comment on the entityClass nullity. This is two methods masquerading as one.

Regarding the last three comments - I agree, my plan was to look into it in the next PR, which focuses on the remaining part of the config code - including config of ValueSelector and EntitySelector. For this PR, I just moved these existing methods to - in my opinion - a more suitable place without changing their internals.
I should have clearly stated my intentions before opening the PR for review.
Is this what the code formatter does? Pretty sure it fits on one 120-char line.

No, the formatter is not guilty; there must have been a new line already and the formatter didn't touch it, precisely as we wanted. Some of the test methods were moved from a different test class.
Good catch, thanks!
